cards.name: Academy Rector
cards.originalText: When Academy Rector is put into a graveyard from play, you may remove Academy Rector from the game. If you do, search your library for an enchantment card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You do not have to find an enchantment card if you do not want to, even if you have one in your library.
An enchantment card is any Enchantment card, including Auras.

cards.text: When Academy Rector dies, you may exile it. If you do, search your library for an enchantment card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Archery Training
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put an arrow counter on Archery Training.
Enchanted creature gains "{T}: This creature deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature, where X is the number of arrow counters on the Archery Training enchanting this creature."

rulings.text: If there is more than one Archery Training on a creature, each granted ability counts the counters on the Archery Training that granted that ability.
You do not remove counters when using the ability.
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put an arrow counter on Archery Training.
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature, where X is the number of arrow counters on Archery Training."

cards.flavor: Few warriors dare to challenge a knight of Capashen. Should one do so, there is one fewer.
cards.name: Capashen Knight
cards.originalText:
First strike
{1}{W}: Capashen Knight gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
{1}{W}: Capashen Knight gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Benalia has no need for peacocks to serve as symbols of vanity. The Capashens strut more proudly than any bird.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{2}, Sacrifice Capashen Standard: Draw a card.
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{2}, Sacrifice Capashen Standard: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Their shields are Benalia's outermost battlements.
cards.name: Capashen Templar
cards.originalText: {W}: Capashen Templar gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.text: {W}: Capashen Templar gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "You lived for Serra's love. Will you not die for it?"
cards.name: False Prophet
cards.originalText: When False Prophet is put into a graveyard from play, remove all creatures from the game.

rulings.text: False Prophet only exiles creatures, which means only creature permanents which are on the battlefield. It won't exile itself since it is already in the graveyard.

cards.text: When False Prophet dies, exile all creatures.

cards.flavor: The best defense is to not get hit.
cards.name: Fend Off
cards.originalText:
Cycling {2}
Target creature deals no combat damage this turn.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor: Commanders order soldiers to attack. Field surgeons order them to heal. Both are obeyed without question.
cards.name: Field Surgeon
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Prevent the next 1 damage to target creature this turn.
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

cards.flavor: Who is truer: you who are, or you who are to be?
cards.name: Flicker
cards.originalText: Remove target nontoken permanent from the game, then return it to play under its owner's control.

rulings.text: It will trigger "enters the battlefield" abilities and "leaves the battlefield" abilities. Note that the card does not go to the graveyard, so it will not trigger "goes to the graveyard" abilities.

This could be used to make the target of another spell or ability illegal if this wasn't a sorcery (which makes it really hard to do that). This is because the Flickered permanent leaves the battlefield and then returns as a completely different permanent, and the targeted spell will not recognize it.

This spell effectively "resets" the permanent to being just like it was freshly cast. All counters, Auras, effects, and so on are removed when it is exiled. Then it comes back onto the battlefield like new.

cards.text: Exile target nontoken permanent, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.name: Jasmine Seer
cards.originalText: {2}{W}, {T}: Reveal any number of white cards in your hand. You gain 2 life for each card revealed this way.

rulings.text: You can reveal zero cards and gain zero life.

cards.text: {2}{W}, {T}: Reveal any number of white cards in your hand. You gain 2 life for each card revealed this way.

cards.flavor: The archangels zealously drove Serra's light into every corner of their new home as if their creator still commanded them.
cards.name: Mask of Law and Grace
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gains protection from black and protection from red.

rulings.text: If a text-changing effect is used to change one of the color words so it grants Protection from white, then it will cause itself to be put into the graveyard.

cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from black and from red.

cards.flavor: Behind his eyes is the pain of every soldier his hands have healed.
cards.name: Master Healer
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage to target creature or player this turn.
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Opalescence
cards.originalText: Each other global enchantment is a creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. It's still an enchantment.

rulings.text: Does not animate itself. But can be animated by another Opalescence.

With a Humility and two Opalescences on the battlefield, if Humility has the latest timestamp, then all creatures are 1/1 with no abilities. If the timestamp order is Opalescence, Humility, Opalescence, the second Opalescence is 1/1, and the Humility and first Opalescence are 4/4. If Humility has the earliest timestamp, then everything is 4/4.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

This is the current interaction between Humility and Opalescence: The type-changing effect applies at layer 4, but the rest happens in the applicable layers. The rest of it will apply even if the permanent loses its ability before it's finished applying. So if Opalescence, Humility, and Worship are on the battlefield and Opalescence entered the battlefield before Humility, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments. (Opalescence). Layer 6: Humility and Worship each lose their abilities. (Humility) Layer 7b: Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4. (Opalescence). Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility). But if Humility entered the battlefield before Opalescence, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments (Opalescence). Layer 6: Humility and Worship each lose their abilities (Humility). Layer 7b: Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility). Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4 (Opalescence).

cards.text: Each other non-Aura enchantment is a creature in addition to its other types and has base power and base toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.flavor: A thing of Serra's realm exists only by the grace of her followers' faith.
cards.name: Reliquary Monk
cards.originalText: When Reliquary Monk is put into a graveyard from play, destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.text: When Reliquary Monk dies, destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor: Treasures, trinkets, trash—the relics of the past are brought forth again.
cards.name: Replenish
cards.originalText: Return all enchantment cards from your graveyard to play. (Local enchantments with no permanent to enchant remain in your graveyard.)

rulings.text: It determines what enchantments to return when its resolution starts. If more enchantments go to the graveyard during the resolution, those additional enchantments are ignored.
You must return Auras if possible, even if this means enchanting an opponent's permanent with a good enchantment.

Auras can only be placed on permanents that were on the battlefield before this effect started to resolve. You can't put an enchantment onto the battlefield with Replenish and put an Aura that is also entering the battlefield onto one of those enchantments.

cards.text: Return all enchantment cards from your graveyard to the battlefield. (Auras with nothing to enchant remain in your graveyard.)

cards.flavor: "To forgive our enemies is to forgive ourselves."
cards.name: Sanctimony
cards.originalText: Whenever one of your opponents taps a mountain for mana, you may gain 1 life.

rulings.text: Gaining life is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

cards.text: Whenever an opponent taps a Mountain for mana, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Scent of Jasmine
cards.originalText: Reveal any number of white cards in your hand. You gain 2 life for each card revealed this way.

rulings.text: You reveal cards, and thereby the amount of life gained, on resolution.

cards.text: Reveal any number of white cards in your hand. You gain 2 life for each card revealed this way.

cards.name: Scour
cards.originalText: Remove target enchantment from the game. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

rulings.text: Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.

Scour can target and exile cards that aren't always enchantments, but are enchantments when Scour is cast and resolves (such as creatures turned into enchantments by Soul Sculptor). Scour's exile effect only looks for cards by name, not type.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

cards.text: Exile target enchantment. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that enchantment and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.flavor: An angel's touch can prepare a soldier for battle more than a thousand military drills.

Flying

Flying

Flying
When Aura Thief is put into a graveyard from play, you gain control of all enchantments. (You don't get to move local enchantments.)

rulings.text: Gaining control of an enchantment often isn't very interesting since it probably won't change what the enchantment is doing. It only matters if the enchantment does something specifically to "you" or "an opponent" or if the enchantment has an activated ability (which only the controller can use).

cards.text:
Flying
When Aura Thief dies, you gain control of all enchantments. (You don't get to move Auras.)

This card used to have errata that kept it from triggering if it wasn't cast from your hand. This errata has since been removed, so the ability will trigger regardless of where the Drake was before entering the battlefield.

rulings.text: Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

cards.name: Quash
cards.originalText: Counter target instant or sorcery spell. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

rulings.text: It exiles the countered spell. This is because the first sentence puts the spell into the graveyard before you continue to the second sentence.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not get exiled but all the other copies in the graveyard, hand, and library are exiled.
Quash can exile cards even if the spell countered was a copy of a spell. For example, if you Quash a Boomerang cast from an Isochron Scepter, you may search for and exile cards named Boomerang.

If Quash counters a spell that has had text spliced onto it, only the base spell may be exiled. For example, if you use Quash to counter a Kodama's Might with a Glacial Ray spliced onto it, you may search for and exile only Kodama's Might.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

cards.text: Counter target instant or sorcery spell. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that spell and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Rayne, Academy Chancellor
cards.originalText: Whenever you or a permanent you control is the target of a spell or ability controlled by one of your opponents, you may draw a card, and if Rayne, Academy Chancellor is enchanted, you may draw another card.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability targets multiple permanents you control or targets you and one or more of your permanents, this triggers once for each such target.
The "if" in the card text does not have a special meaning. You check if this card is enchanted when the ability resolves and draw 1 or 2 cards.
When casting an Aura on this card, the triggered ability will resolve before the Aura enters the battlefield.

cards.text: Whenever you or a permanent you control becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, you may draw a card. You may draw an additional card if Rayne, Academy Chancellor is enchanted.

cards.flavor:
"Urza, I've discovered more promising students than you and my husband have, combined. And I haven't lost a single one."

cards.text: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Apprentice Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste. At the beginning of the next end step, sacrifice it.

cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.name: Body Snatcher
cards.originalText:
When Body Snatcher comes into play, you may choose and discard a creature card from your hand. If you don't, remove Body Snatcher from the game.
When Body Snatcher is put into a graveyard from play, remove Body Snatcher from the game and return target creature card from your graveyard to play.

rulings.text: You choose whether or not to discard on resolution.
You can choose to target itself to return to the battlefield, but the exiling happens first and so the return will fail.

cards.text:
When Body Snatcher enters the battlefield, exile it unless you discard a creature card.
When Body Snatcher dies, exile Body Snatcher and return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: The muck claims a hundred living things for each meager treasure it spews forth.
cards.name: Bubbling Muck
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps a swamp for mana, it produces an additional {B}.

rulings.text: Affects lands with type Swamp, not lands that are named "Swamp."
Affects lands tapped for rest of turn, not just swamps on the battlefield at the time it resolves. This is because it affects players and not the lands themselves.

cards.text: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps a Swamp for mana, that player adds {B} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.flavor: "‘Davvol, blast those elves.' ‘Davvol, transport those troops.' No one cares that today is my birthday."
cards.name: Carnival of Souls
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play, you lose 1 life and add {B} to your mana pool.

rulings.text: This is not optional.

cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, you lose 1 life and add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Many sent to serve Davvol carried such instruments, as if to remind him who their true masters were.

cards.originalText: When Chime of Night is put into a graveyard from play, destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Chime of Night is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.flavor: Rath is a disease all its inhabitants carry.
cards.name: Disease Carriers
cards.originalText: When Disease Carriers is put into a graveyard from play, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.text: When Disease Carriers dies, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: This is a world of spiteful wasps that sting and kill even as they die.
cards.name: Dying Wail
cards.originalText: When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard from play, target player chooses and discards two cards from his or her hand.

rulings.text: If they have less than 2 cards, they discard all the cards they have.
It only triggers on a creature going to the graveyard from the battlefield.

cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, target player discards two cards.

cards.flavor:
"The rate of spread in this region is unacceptable. Start again."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath
cards.name: Encroach
cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose a nonbasic land card from it. That player discards that card.

rulings.text: You choose a land card that is not a basic land.
If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonbasic land card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Eradicate
cards.originalText: Remove target nonblack creature from the game. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

rulings.text: Use the name of the card as it leaves the battlefield.

If a copy card is targeted by this effect, you get to look for another copy of the card it is copying. This is because a copy card actually takes on the name and initial characteristics of what it copies.
Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.

If you manage to turn a land (such as a Forest or Stalking Stones) into a creature, you can indeed use this effect on that basic land type. Eradicate's exile effect only looks for cards by name, not type.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

A face-down creature has no name, so no card can possibly share a name with it (not even other cards with no name). If you Eradicate a face-down creature you will still search its controller's library, but you won't be able to exile any cards from that library.

cards.text: Exile target nonblack creature. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that creature and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Festering Wound
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put an infection counter on Festering Wound.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Festering Wound deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of infection counters on Festering Wound.

rulings.text: If it is on your creature, you can decide whether to add a counter before or after it damages you.
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put an infection counter on Festering Wound.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Festering Wound deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of infection counters on Festering Wound.

cards.flavor: Often it's not the hunter or the hunted but the opportunist who thrives in Rath.
cards.name: Lurking Jackals
cards.originalText: When one of your opponents has 10 life or less, if Lurking Jackals is an enchantment, it becomes a 3/2 Hound creature.

rulings.text: Once it becomes a creature, it will not change back into an enchantment if your opponent's life total goes back above 10.
Once it becomes a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.text: When an opponent has 10 or less life, if Lurking Jackals is an enchantment, it becomes a 3/2 Hound creature.

rulings.text: You can reveal zero cards to give -0/-0 to a creature.

cards.text: {2}{B}, {T}: Reveal any number of black cards in your hand. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

cards.flavor: Being one would be an honor, if the word "honor" had any meaning in Phyrexia.

cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Phyrexian Monitor.

cards.flavor: They exist to cease.

Trample

rulings.text: Sacrificing this card does not prevent you from having to make the other sacrifices.

cards.text:
Trample

cards.flavor: "They're not just retrievers, they're carriers."

cards.text:

cards.flavor: The grave robbers arrived the day after the burial. They were a day too late.
cards.name: Rapid Decay
cards.originalText:
Cycling {2}
Remove from the game up to three target cards in a single graveyard.

rulings.text: You pick the cards during announcement. If any are not there on resolution, any others that are there are still affected.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.text:
Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor:
"For all the priceless tomes they have destroyed, one would think they would taste better."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath

cards.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

cards.flavor:
"This monstrosity will do—for now."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath
cards.name: Skittering Horror
cards.originalText: When you play a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Horror.

rulings.text: Triggers when you announce a creature spell, and will resolve before that creature is put onto the battlefield.

cards.text: When you cast a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Horror.

cards.flavor: Davvol encouraged the skirges; they made excellent sentries and were quite edible if properly seasoned.

cards.originalText:

cards.flavor: As no one has ever accepted a second invitation to Davvol's table, the evincar often dines alone.
cards.name: Soul Feast
cards.originalText: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
cards.text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.

cards.flavor: Only the coldest hearts and the strongest stomachs can stand against it.

cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.flavor: Gatha showed remarkable prowess in increasing his subjects' stature. Their lifespans, however, were another matter.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +3/-1.

cards.flavor: He craves only one commodity.

cards.originalText:
Skip your draw step.

cards.text:
Skip your draw step.

cards.flavor: When Gatha fell, he was called to account for each abomination he created.
cards.name: Aether Sting
cards.originalText: Whenever one of your opponents plays a creature spell, Æther Sting deals 1 damage to that player.

rulings.text: The ability triggers when an opponent casts a creature spell, and goes on the stack above that spell. As such, the ability will deal 1 damage to that player before the creature enters the battlefield.

cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, Aether Sting deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.flavor: After their first encounter, the goblins named him Chuck.

cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Gatha survived as long as he did by giving all Keld's predators exactly what they wanted.
cards.name: Covetous Dragon
cards.originalText:
Flying
When you control no artifacts, sacrifice Covetous Dragon.

rulings.text: The ability will trigger if you don't control an artifact, even for a brief moment during the resolution of another spell or ability.
The ability only checks if you control no artifacts at the time it triggers. It does not check again on resolution. So gaining control of an artifact before then will not save the Dragon.

cards.text:
Flying
When you control no artifacts, sacrifice Covetous Dragon.

cards.flavor: "What are we celebratin' again?"
cards.name: Goblin Festival
cards.originalText: {2}: Goblin Festival deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, choose one of your opponents. That player gains control of Goblin Festival.

rulings.text: If you activate this multiple times in a row so the stack has more than one of this ability on it, the abilities will still resolve even if Goblin Festival leaves the battlefield or leaves your control before they resolve. For example, if activate the ability twice, and after the first flip you lose control of it because you lost the toss, or it leaves the battlefield, then you still flip for the second ability.

The controller of the ability chooses one of his or her opponents. If this card changes controllers before the ability resolves, you still pick an opponent of the player who controlled it when it was activated.

cards.text: {2}: Goblin Festival deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, choose one of your opponents. That player gains control of Goblin Festival.

cards.flavor: "Grow food in dirt? Save time—eat dirt."
cards.name: Goblin Gardener

rulings.text: The ability is not optional. You have to choose one of your own lands if your opponent has none.

cards.flavor:

rulings.text: If a spell is countered, it still counts as having been cast.

cards.text: At the beginning of each player's end step, if that player didn't cast a spell this turn, Impatience deals 2 damage to him or her.

cards.flavor: The climax of a warlord's career is always death.
cards.name: Reckless Abandon
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Reckless Abandon, sacrifice a creature.
Reckless Abandon deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Reckless Abandon, sacrifice a creature.
Reckless Abandon deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Not all Keld's warriors are found on the battlefield.

cards.text: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, Repercussion deals that much damage to that creature's controller.

cards.text: Reveal any number of red cards in your hand. Scent of Cinder deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

cards.name: Sowing Salt
cards.originalText: Remove target nonbasic land from the game. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

rulings.text: Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

cards.text: Exile target nonbasic land. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that land and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.flavor: Keldon warriors don't need signals to tell them when to attack, but when to stop.
cards.name: Trumpet Blast
cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.
Even though Trumpet Blast affects only attacking creatures, the bonus will remain for the rest of the turn.
Only creatures that are attacking as Trumpet Blast resolves will receive the bonus. In other words, casting it before you've declared attackers usually won't do anything.

cards.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
Land charred black, rivers boiled,
Crops and wells alike despoiled,
Mountains leveled, forests felled—
Footprints of the beasts of Keld.
cards.name: Wake of Destruction
cards.originalText: Destroy target land and all lands with the same name as that land.

rulings.text: Only looks at the card name, so it will not destroy lands that just share the destroyed land's type.

cards.text: Destroy target land and all other lands with the same name as that land.

cards.flavor: You'll never get a Keldon's goat.

cards.flavor: The Phyrexian killing machines couldn't have known the seriousness of their mistake in wounding the ape—they'd never seen it angry.

cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback.
cards.text: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.flavor:
A fruit must rot before its seed can sprout.
—Yavimaya saying
cards.name: Compost
cards.originalText: Whenever a black card is put into one of your opponents' graveyards, you may draw a card.

rulings.text: The ability triggers on a black card being discarded, milled, or countered, as well as a black card going to the graveyard from the battlefield.

cards.text: Whenever a black card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor: Like a masterful quilter, Yavimaya stitches together patches of color to warn its denizens of threats.
cards.name: Elvish Lookout
cards.originalText: Elvish Lookout can't be the target of spells or abilities.
cards.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching
cards.name: Elvish Piper
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Put a creature card from your hand into play.

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: The king of Yavimaya's waters pays constant attention to his subjects . . . and thrives on their adulation.
cards.name: Emperor Crocodile
cards.originalText: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.

rulings.text: Emperor Crocodile's ability will trigger if you don't control another creature, even if it's only for a brief moment during the resolution of another spell or ability (such as that of Brago, King Eternal).
The ability only checks if you control no other creatures at the time it triggers. It does not check again on resolution, so gaining control of a creature before then will not save Emperor Crocodile.

cards.text: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.

cards.name: Gamekeeper
cards.originalText: When Gamekeeper is put into a graveyard from play, you may remove Gamekeeper from the game. If you do, reveal cards from your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card into play and put the other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.

rulings.text: If you have no creature cards in your library, all the cards from your library end up in your graveyard and you do not get to put a creature onto the battlefield.
Exiling this card is optional.

cards.text: When Gamekeeper dies, you may exile it. If you do, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card onto the battlefield and put all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: The balance of nature dictates that one day humans will be stepped on by bugs.

cards.flavor:
"This is my place of power. Nothing can take root here unless I allow it."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer
cards.name: Multani's Decree
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments. You gain 2 life for each enchantment destroyed this way.
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments. You gain 2 life for each enchantment destroyed this way.

cards.name: Pattern of Rebirth
cards.originalText: When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard from play, that creature's controller may search his or her library for a creature card and put that card into play. If that player does, he or she then shuffles his or her library.

rulings.text: Searching for a creature card is optional.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, that creature's controller may search his or her library for a creature card and put that card onto the battlefield. If that player does, he or she shuffles his or her library.

cards.flavor: Most spiders wait patiently for their prey to arrive. Most spiders aren't forty feet tall.
cards.name: Plated Spider
cards.originalText: Plated Spider may block as though it had flying.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor:
To renew the land, plow the land. To destroy the land, do nothing.
—Druids' saying
cards.name: Plow Under

rulings.text: The owner decides the order the two lands are stacked there.

cards.text: Put two target lands on top of their owners' libraries.

cards.flavor:
"Rise, elf. We are both of Gaea, and thus we are equal."
—Multani, to Rofellos
cards.name: Rofellos's Gift

rulings.text: You reveal and you choose cards during the resolution.

cards.text: Reveal any number of green cards in your hand. Return an enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand for each card revealed this way.

cards.originalText: Reveal any number of green cards in your hand. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

rulings.text: You reveal cards, and thereby set the value of X, on resolution.

cards.text: Reveal any number of green cards in your hand. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

cards.name: Splinter
cards.originalText: Remove target artifact from the game. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

rulings.text: Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.

Splinter can target and exile cards that aren't always artifacts, but are artifacts when Splinter is cast and resolves (such as an animated Stalking Stones). Splinter's exile effect only looks for cards by name, not type.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

cards.text: Exile target artifact. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that artifact and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.flavor: Much to Multani's chagrin, Rofellos gleefully tutored Yavimaya's elves on the rudest and most vulgar words spoken in Llanowar.
cards.name: Taunting Elf
cards.originalText: All creatures able to block Taunting Elf do so.
cards.text: All creatures able to block Taunting Elf do so.

cards.flavor: Rain from this storm leaves you pinned to the ground like an insect.
cards.name: Thorn Elemental
cards.originalText: Thorn Elemental may deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.text: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Yavimaya Elder
cards.originalText:
When Yavimaya Elder is put into a graveyard from play, you may search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{2}, Sacrifice Yavimaya Elder: Draw a card.
cards.text:
When Yavimaya Elder dies, you may search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{2}, Sacrifice Yavimaya Elder: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: From each seed, a world. From each world, a thousand seeds.
cards.name: Yavimaya Enchantress
cards.originalText: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment in play.
cards.text: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"I think it no accident that every civilized people has discovered the art of distillation."
—Rofellos of Llanowar
cards.name: Braidwood Cup
cards.originalText: {T}: You gain 1 life.
cards.text: {T}: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Braidwood Sextant
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Braidwood Sextant: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Braidwood Sextant: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: The students disliked the secretary for its unfailing memory—until they discovered it couldn't dodge thrown objects.
cards.name: Brass Secretary
cards.originalText: {2}, Sacrifice Brass Secretary: Draw a card.
cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice Brass Secretary: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Toward the end, Gatha struggled to keep his experiments in and his patrons out.
cards.name: Caltrops
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature attacks, Caltrops deals 1 damage to it.
cards.text: Whenever a creature attacks, Caltrops deals 1 damage to it.

cards.flavor: As the invasion drew closer, Urza's means began to resemble Phyrexia's end.
cards.name: Extruder
cards.originalText:
Echo
Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

rulings.text: It can choose itself as the target, but it will be countered when it tries to resolve since it will no longer be on the battlefield. This is useful only when you want to simply destroy this card.

cards.text:
Echo {4} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.flavor:
Step 1: Find your cousin.
Step 2: Get your cousin in the cannon.
Step 3: Find another cousin.
cards.name: Fodder Cannon
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Fodder Cannon deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.text: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Fodder Cannon deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.flavor: Garbage in, treasure out.
cards.name: Junk Diver
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Junk Diver is put into a graveyard from play, return another target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.text:
Flying
When Junk Diver dies, return another target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Tawnos left a legacy of animal designs in many of Urza's creations.
cards.name: Mantis Engine
cards.originalText:
{2}: Mantis Engine gains flying until end of turn.
{2}: Mantis Engine gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.text:
{2}: Mantis Engine gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{2}: Mantis Engine gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Masticore
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose and discard a card from your hand. If you don't, sacrifice Masticore.
{2}: Masticore deals 1 damage to target creature.
{2}: Regenerate Masticore.
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Masticore unless you discard a card.
{2}: Masticore deals 1 damage to target creature.
{2}: Regenerate Masticore.

cards.flavor:
"At this rate I fully expect to be replaced by a clockwork golem by year's end."
—Barrin
cards.name: Metalworker
cards.originalText: {T}: Reveal any number of artifact cards in your hand. Add two colorless mana to your mana pool for each card revealed this way.

rulings.text: This is a mana ability. It does not go on the stack and can't be responded to.
You can reveal zero cards to gain zero mana.

cards.text: {T}: Reveal any number of artifact cards in your hand. Add {C}{C} to your mana pool for each card revealed this way.

cards.name: Powder Keg
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fuse counter on Powder Keg.
{T}, Sacrifice Powder Keg: Destroy each artifact and creature with converted mana cost equal to the number of fuse counters on Powder Keg.

rulings.text: Only destroys artifacts and creatures with exactly the specified cost. It does not mean "less than or equal to".
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fuse counter on Powder Keg.
{T}, Sacrifice Powder Keg: Destroy each artifact and creature with converted mana cost equal to the number of fuse counters on Powder Keg.

cards.name: Scrying Glass
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Choose a number greater than 0 and a color. Target opponent reveals his or her hand. If that opponent reveals exactly the chosen number of cards of the chosen color, you draw a card.

rulings.text: The only valid colors are white, black, blue, red, and green.
You choose a target opponent on announcement. You choose a number and color during resolution, then the targeted opponent reveals their hand.

cards.text: {3}, {T}: Choose a number greater than 0 and a color. Target opponent reveals his or her hand. If that opponent reveals exactly the chosen number of cards of the chosen color, you draw a card.

cards.name: Storage Matrix
cards.originalText: As long as Storage Matrix is untapped, instead of each player untapping the permanents he or she controls during his or her untap step, that player chooses artifacts, creatures, or lands and untaps all permanents of the chosen type he or she controls.

rulings.text: This card's ability does not override effects which prevent a permanent from untapping.
Permanents with multiple types untap if any of their types is chosen. For example, an artifact creature untaps if either artifact or creature is chosen.

If another effect limits the number of permanents that untap, that number combines with Storage Matrix's effect. For example, Imi Statue says "players can't untap more than one artifact during their untap steps." If both Imi Statue and an untapped Storage Matrix are on the battlefield, and you choose "artifact," only one artifact untaps.

cards.text: As long as Storage Matrix is untapped, each player chooses artifact, creature, or land during his or her untap step. That player can untap only permanents of the chosen type this step.

cards.flavor: Urza's metathran children were conceived, birthed, and nurtured by an integrated system of machines.
cards.name: Thran Dynamo
cards.originalText: {T}: Add three colorless mana to your mana pool.
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"What we do not use up, we use again."
—Urza
cards.name: Thran Foundry
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}, Remove Thran Foundry from the game: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Exile Thran Foundry: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

cards.flavor: Karn felt more secure about his value to Urza when he realized he didn't need regular trimming.
cards.name: Thran Golem
cards.originalText: As long as Thran Golem is enchanted, it gets +2/+2 and gains flying, first strike, and trample.
cards.text: As long as Thran Golem is enchanted, it gets +2/+2 and has flying, first strike, and trample.

cards.flavor:
"Stop thinking like an artificer, Urza, and start thinking like a father!"
—Rayne, Academy Chancellor
cards.name: Urza's Incubator
cards.originalText:
When Urza's Incubator comes into play, choose a creature type.
Creature spells of the chosen type cost {2} less to play.

rulings.text: Multiple Incubators are cumulative.
You choose a creature type right as it enters the battlefield, before any continuous effects are applied or trigged abilities trigger.

cards.text:
As Urza's Incubator enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creature spells of the chosen type cost {2} less to cast.

cards.flavor: For all its traps and defenses, Yavimaya has its havens, too.
cards.name: Yavimaya Hollow
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{G}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{G}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.
